alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Coshocton; Tuscarawas (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 15 at 10:26PM EDT until June 15 at 10:45PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 PM EDT FOR NORTHEASTERN COSHOCTON...SOUTHWESTERN CARROLL AND TUSCARAWAS COUNTIES... At 1026 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near East Sparta to Sugarcreek to near Farmerstown to Killbuck, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is possible. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines, resulting in some power outages. Locations impacted include... New Philadelphia, Dover, Uhrichsville, Dennison, Strasburg, Sugarcreek, Gnadenhutten, Tuscarawas, Bolivar, Baltic, Midvale, and Mineral City. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare immediately for large hail and damaging winds. People outside should move to a shelter, inside a strong building and away from windows. Please report severe weather by calling 412-262-1988, posting to the NWS Pittsburgh Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSPITTSBURGH.
